intro: Conohoria megapotamica, commonly known as the Andean morning glory, is a climbing vine native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy, five-petaled blooms that range in color from white to deep purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing along riverbanks and in moist, shaded areas. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable regions.
